title: FallenSoldier
author: FallenSoldier
content: We are starting a community for traders, crypto/NFT enthusiasts where you also have pro traders that mentor you and teach you the way to trade and the risk managements strategies. If you're not interested in learning but still want a pro to trade for you, you can allocate an amount to a pro trader and he will trade for you.What do you get by being a Fallen Apes?Investment Pool: Join a Pro Trader pool with your Staking RewardsTrading Classes/Mentor, Giveways & Free $FAPA Private Community With Alpha, Traders & Crypto ConnoisseursStake your NFT & Earn 10-30% APY in USDtThere is a cap on how much you can allocate to a trader for each NFT, and by staking your NFT you earn USDt, which you can add to an investment pool and earn a higher yield.One of our trader started a 1k to 10k challenge in 20 days challenge, where he document his journey on twitter ( Entry, when he close and daily update ) Day 11 update : https://twitter.com/shorterprince/status/1560339398050414593 Follow us on twitter : https://twitter.com/FallenApesNFTWebsite : https://www.fallenapes.com/Discord : https://discord.gg/araeE4U4

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: FallenSoldier on August 19, 2022, 02:50:24 PMWe are starting a community for traders, crypto/NFT enthusiasts where you also have pro traders that mentor you and teach you the way to trade and the risk managements strategies. If you're not interested in learning but still want a pro to trade for you, you can allocate an amount to a pro trader and he will trade for you.This alone pissed me off, you will act like you are a good trader, newbies will send some amount for you to help them to trade with it, if the trading gone wrong, the newbie lose, or this might even be a scam from the beginning. But anything this would be, newbies would only fall for it and send you money in order for you to just scam them. No experienced trader would be so foolish and send you money to trade for them when they know that scam or money loss is the end result.Newbies should all avoid this. Old traders can not be foolish to go for it.

comments.author: FallenSoldier
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on August 19, 2022, 03:09:06 PMQuote from: FallenSoldier on August 19, 2022, 02:50:24 PMWe are starting a community for traders, crypto/NFT enthusiasts where you also have pro traders that mentor you and teach you the way to trade and the risk managements strategies. If you're not interested in learning but still want a pro to trade for you, you can allocate an amount to a pro trader and he will trade for you.This alone pissed me off, you will act like you are a good trader, newbies will send some amount for you to help them to trade with it, if the trading gone wrong, the newbie lose, or this might even be a scam from the beginning. But anything this would be, newbies would only fall for it and send you money in order for you to just scam them. No experienced trader would be so foolish and send you money to trade for them when they know that scam or money loss is the end result.Newbies should all avoid this. Old traders can not be foolish to go for it.That's not how Fallen Apes work. We don't ask for deposit, the USDt you receive by staking the NFT, you can choose an investment pool depending on the history of the trader.It's like a trading wagon, you may win or lose but at the end of the day it's a professional trading for you, and it's the one you chose depending on his history.Also we have a cap for how much you can deposit per NFT, if you wish to deposit. To lower everyone risk, and limits will probably stay low until we have made sure the platform is 100% safe and got audited.

comments.author: palle11
comments.body: Quote from: FallenSoldier on August 19, 2022, 02:50:24 PMThere is a cap on how much you can allocate to a trader for each NFT, and by staking your NFT you earn USDt, which you can add to an investment pool and earn a higher yield.Quote from: Oshosondy on August 19, 2022, 03:09:06 PMNewbies should all avoid this. Old traders can not be foolish to go for it.That also looking like a networking or Ponzi where you have to register stake then reward is in a different coin. It doesn't look straight to be understood and trusted except op does more to explain and paste a review of what has been going on from the website otherwise I don't expect that users here would visit that.
